sourcesContent:
import { HttpClient } from '@angular/common/http'; import { Component } from '@angular/core'; import { WeatherService } from '../services/weather.service'; @Component({ selector: 'app-weather', templateUrl: './weather.component.html', styleUrls: ['./weather.component.css'] }) export class WeatherComponent { weather: any; city: string = ''; //constructor(private weatherService : WeatherService){ } constructor(private http: HttpClient){} private apiUrl = 'http://localhost:8080/weather'; // call the service from getWeather and make the service call the api getWeather(city : string) : void { console.log("get weather"); console.log(city); const url = `${this.apiUrl}/${city}`; console.log(url); let response = this.http.get(url); console.log(response); response.subscribe( (data) => { this.weather=data; console.log(this.weather); console.log("max temp ", this.weather.main.temp_max); console.log("max temp ", this.weather.main.temp_min); }, (error) => { console.log(error); } ); console.log("abcd"); } onSubmit() : void { this.getWeather(this.city); } } new code with multiple cities
